Berikut Data Korban Luka Penertiban Tambang Liar Belitung
03 Nov 2019, 17:01 by Miechell Octovy Koagouw


Berikut Data Korban Luka Penertiban Tambang Liar Belitung

KBRN, Jakarta : Penertiban tambang timah ilegal berakhir ricuh di Sungai Sengkelik, Desa Sijuk, Kecamatan Sijuk, Kabupaten Belitung, Provinsi Bangka Belitung (Babel), Sabtu (2/11/2019). Polisi menyebutkan penertiban tambang itu tidak berkoordinasi dengan pihak aparat penegak hukum, TNI, serta pemangku kepentingan terkait."Mereka (Satpol PP) tidak melakukan koordinasi, itu yang sangat kami sayangkan," kata Kapolres Belitung AKBP Yudhis Wibisana kepada wartawan, seperti dilansir detikcom, Minggu (3/11/2019).Kericuhan terjadi berawal dari tindakan arogan Satpol PP yang membakar 20 set mesin TI (tambang inkonvensional) milik masyarakat. Melihat kelakuan Satpol PP, rakyat mengamuk hingga mengejar semua personel Pamong Praja yang lari tunggang-langgang masuk hutan. Ratusan personel Satpol PP bentrok dengan masyarakat setempat hingga jatuh korban luka-luka dan kendaraan operasional rusak berat.BACA JUGA: Wagub Babel Minta Perkara Tambang Liar Dihentikan, Polisi Jalan Terus
Polisi menangkap sekaligus menggelar pemeriksaan intensif terhadap para pelaku tindakan anarkis. Tercatat 10 orang diangkut ke Mapolres Belitung, lima dari unsur masyarakat dan lima lagi dari unsur Satpol PP.Berikut data korban luka personel Satpol PP:Nurul Ihsan (40) luka di bagian kepalaHandi Pamungkas (35) luka memar di lengan kananMustarifah (21) luka di jari tengah dan telunjukPermana Yusuf (39) luka kepala bagian belakangIim (33) luka robek di kepala serta bengkak lengan kiriDarmawi (40) luka di perut kiri dan bengkak di tangan kiriSuryadi (37) keseleo lengan kananSelain korban luka-luka, menurut catatan kepolisian, 7 (tujuh) kendaraan dirusak massa, yaitu:1 unit truk dinas Sat Pol PP Belitung Timur1 unit truk dinas Kebersihan Belitung Timur1 unit mobil dinas putih (mobil Wagub)1 unit mobil hitam1 unit mobil abu-abu1 unit mobil putih1 unit mobil dobel kabin warna hitam Hal menarik yang ditemukan kepolisian dalam pemeriksaan kepada para pelaku, saat penertiban dilakukan oleh Satpol PP yang dipimpin Wakil Gubernur (Wagub) Abdul Fatah, sebenarnya lokasi penambangan liar sedang tidak ada aktivitas. Sudah satu pekan belakangan, para penambang tidak bekerja karena sesuatu dan lain hal."Jadi kondisi para penambang tersebut sudah lama tidak beraktivitas," ujar Yudhis.BACA JUGA: Pemprov Babel Gerebek Pelanggar Pidana Tanpa Polisi, Kenapa?
Seperti diberitakan RRI sebelumnya, kedua belah pihak yang bertikai, sudah melakukan mediasi. Terutama antara masyarakat yang jadi penambang liar dengan Satpol PP. Bahkan Wagub Abdul Fatah juga meminta agar masalah ini tidak usah dilanjutkan menjadi perkara. Namun pihak Polres Belitung tidak melihat itu sebagai jalan keluar, karena sudah terjadi tindakan pidana di lokasi kejadian. Dari penambangan timah liar, itu sudah pelanggaran yang diancam pidana penjara. Kemudian kericuhan berujung pembakaran dan usaha melukai orang lain juga ada ancaman pidana di situ."Keinginan Pak Wagub agar tidak dilanjutkan perkara tersebut. Namun kami melihat perkembangannya. Polres tetap olah TKP (tempat kejadian perkara), pemeriksaan saksi, mengamankan barang bukti, dan yang lainnya," tegas Yudhis.Wajar jika kepolisian tetap melanjutkan proses ini, karena menurut data yang didapatkan, akibat kericuhan kemarin, 7 (tujuh) anggota Satpol PP mengalami luka-luka hingga harus mendapatkan perawatan medis di RSUD Tanjungpandan, serta 7 (tujuh) kendaraan dinas dan pribadi dirusak massa.Kemudian, polisi juga masih memeriksa 10 orang yang ditangkap, karena tersiar kabar santer bahwa terjadi penyanderaan terhadap Wagub Babel Abdul Fatah oleh masyarakat ketika meletus kericuhan. Walau tidak terluka, akan tetapi tindakan penyanderaan juga menjadi salah satu yang perlu didalami. Polisi menduga ada aktor provokator dibalik kejadian tersebut.

KBRN, Jakarta: Enforcement of illegal tin mines ends in chaos in S Sustik River, Sijuk Village, Sijuk District, Belitung Regency, Bangka Belitung Province (Babel), Saturday (2/11/2019). The police said the control of the mine was not coordinating with law enforcement officials, the TNI, and related stakeholders. "They (Satpol PP) did not coordinate, that's what we really regret," said Belitung Police Chief AKBP Yudhis Wibisana told reporters, as reported by AFP. Sunday (11/03/2019). The riots began with the arrogant actions of the Satpol PP who set fire to 20 sets of community-owned IT machines. Seeing the behavior of Satpol PP, the people went berserk to chase all the Civil Service personnel who ran helter-skelter into the forest. Hundreds of Satpol PP personnel clashed with the local community until they fell injured and operational vehicles were severely damaged. READ ALSO: Deputy Governor of Babel Requests Illegal Mining Case Stopped, Police Road Continues
The police arrested as well as held an intensive examination of the perpetrators of anarchist acts. 10 people were transported to the Belitung Mapolres, five from community elements and five from Satpol PP elements. Following the wounding data of Satpol PP personnel: Nurul Ihsan (40) wounds on the headHandi Pamungkas (35) bruises on right armMustarifah (21) injuries on the middle and index fingerPermana Yusuf (39) head injury to the backIm (33) head injury and swelling of the left armDarmawi (40) wound in the left abdomen and swelling in the left handSuryadi (37) sprained right armIn addition to the injured, according to police records , 7 (seven) vehicles were damaged by the mass, namely: 1 unit of East Belitung Policing Sat PP 1 unit of East Belitung Cleanliness Truck 1 unit of white official car (Wagub car) 1 unit of black car1 unit of gray car1 unit of white car1 unit of double cabin car black color Interesting things were found by the police in examining the perpetrators, when the control was carried out by Satpol PP led by Deputy Governor (Deputy Governor) Abdul Fatah, the actual location of illegal mining was being no activity. It's been a week, the miners are not working for something and other reasons. "So the condition of the miners has not been active for a long time," said Yudhis. As RRI reported earlier, the two warring parties had mediated. Especially between people who become illegal miners and Satpol PP. Even Deputy Governor Abdul Fatah also requested that this matter should not proceed as a case. But the Belitung Regional Police did not see that as a way out, because a criminal action had taken place at the scene. From illegal tin mining, it is a violation that is punishable by imprisonment. Then the riots led to arson and attempts to injure others there was also a criminal threat there. "The Deputy Governor's desire that the case was not continued. But we saw its development. other, "said Yudhis. Fairly if the police continue this process, because according to the data obtained, due to the riot yesterday, 7 (seven) Satpol PP members were injured and had to get medical treatment at Tanjungpandan Regional Hospital, and 7 (seven) vehicles service and personal damage to the masses. Then, the police also still questioned 10 people who were arrested, because word broke out that there was a hostage taking on the Deputy Governor of Babylon Abdul Fatah by the public when the riot broke out. Although not injured, but the act of hostage taking is also one that needs to be explored. Police suspect there is a provocateur behind the incident.
